title: What We Learned from Stephanie Grisham's Trump Tell-All, I'll Take Your Questions Now
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
In her new book, Stephanie Grisham reveals a peek behind the scenes of the Trump White House, “where everything was like a clown car on fire running at full speed into a warehouse of fireworks.”
Another day, another Trumpworld memoir. The latest damning dispatch from the Trump Administration comes courtesy of Stephanie Grisham, who served various roles in the White House throughout a four-year period: communications director and press secretary in the West Wing, as well as communications director and chief of staff in Melania Trump’s East Wing. In I’ll Take Your Questions Now, her new memoir, Grisham depicts a White House “where everything was like a clown car on fire running at full speed into a warehouse of fireworks.” Caught between the president’s abusive leadership style and the conflicting loyalties she felt toward the first lady, Grisham’s final straw came on January 6, 2021, when she tendered her resignation hours into the insurrection at the Capitol. 
The Trumps, for their part, have already moved to discredit Grisham. Describing Grisham as “very angry and bitter” after a break-up, President Trump said in a statement, “Stephanie didn’t have what it takes and that was obvious from the beginning. She had big problems and we felt that she should work out those problems for herself. Now, like everyone else, she gets paid by a radical left-leaning publisher to say bad and untrue things.” Melania Trump also clapped back, saying in a statement, "The author is desperately trying to rehabilitate her tarnished reputation by manipulating and distorting the truth about Mrs. Trump. Ms. Grisham is a deceitful and troubled individual who doesn’t deserve anyone’s trust."
Grisham’s account, like any Trumpworld memoir, must be read with a healthy dose of skepticism. After all, as Grisham herself admits, “Casual dishonesty filtered through the White House as though it were in the air conditioning system.” But Grisham anticipates that readers may not take her account at face value, writing, “This is not, by the way, a book where you need to like me.” We read I’ll Take Your Questions Now in advance of publication; now, we’re breaking down the biggest bombshells below.
First up: Grisham offers insight into the daily routines of the first lady, and the derisive nickname they inspired:
According to Grisham, there was no lost love between Melania Trump and her stepchildren, particularly Ivanka Trump:
Inappropriate behavior on the part of the Kushners earned the couple their own derisive nickname. “Because they dabbled in a bit of everything and could be precocious and self-absorbed, we in the East Wing dubbed [the Kushners] ‘the interns,’” Grisham writes. “Mrs. Trump was amused and herself used the nickname every now and then.” Tension between the East Wing and the Kushners is an enduring theme throughout the book, with Grisham continually emphasizing the conflicts of interest proposed by the Kushners’ role in the administration.  Take, for example, the matter of Jared Kushner’s security clearance:
Remembering when Kushner teamed up with speechwriter Stephen Miller to write a televised address at the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, Grisham writes at length about what she saw as Kushner’s poisonous influence in the White House:
But the Kushners aren’t the only Trumpworld acolytes to come under fire in I’ll Take Your Questions Now. Grisham doesn’t mince words when writing about Trump sycophant Lindsey Graham:
Grisham, like many other Trumpworld alums, takes note of Trump’s obsession with dictators. But it’s her recollection of 2019’s G20 Summit in Osaka that’s the most chilling, suggesting an all-too cozy rapport between Trump and Vladimir Putin:
The most interesting moments in I'll Take Your Questions Now come when Grisham offers a look behind the scenes of memorable moments. Take, for example, her recollections about the hand slap heard ‘round the world. In 2017, Melania Trump made headlines when she appeared to slap her husband’s hand away during a diplomatic visit to Saudi Arabia in 2017. The truth, according to Grisham, is less interesting:
Grisham also delves into the Stormy Daniels scandal from 2018, remembering when Daniels sued Donald Trump over his efforts to suppress her disclosure of their affair. In the ensuing media blitz, Daniels likened Trump’s penis to a toadstool—a depiction he took such issue with that he called Grisham from Air Force One to set the record straight. 
Remember Trump's mysterious visit to Walter Reed Medical Center in 2019, when protocol was disrupted and doctors were asked to sign NDAs? Grisham takes us behind the scenes there, too. 
But we know the real behind-the-scenes story you want to know about: behind the scenes of Trump's haircare routine. Grisham has got you covered:
That’s all for now, dear reader. We’ll see you next time there's a Trumpworld memoir to excavate, which surely won’t be long. 
Adrienne Westenfeld is the Books and Fiction Editor at Esquire, where she oversees books coverage, edits fiction, and curates the Esquire Book Club.

title: 11 Indigenous Designers to Support on Indigenous Peoples’ Day and Always
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
This month, we celebrate and honor Native American people and commemorate their histories and cultures. But the time to support Indigenous artists is year-round. Sustainability and tradition are often at the forefront of Indigenous design, whether it’s the way Keri Ataumbi  uses visual storytelling in her jewelry or the history behind Jamie Gentry’s bespoke moccasin boutique. For Amy Denet Deal of 4KINSHIP, creativity is also about telling Indigenous stories, which have so often been misunderstood or not told at all. “I want people to know we are limitless,” she says. “Our creativity has been highly coveted by the fashion industry, and for decades has been appropriated. It’s our time to step into the fashion space to tell our own stories and present our own creative visions ourselves.”  
By uplifting Indigenous, Native American, and First Nation-owned brands, you help grow small businesses, spread inclusivity, and encourage authentic art. “There is such a pan-indigenous view of native people, yet we are over 574 different tribes, so there is certainly not just one point of view,” Denet Deal says. We hope to see more and more of these talented visionaries sharing their perspectives in the years to come. For now, here are 11 designers to support this Indigenous Peoples’ Day—and always. 
Korina Emmerich descends from a long line of Coast Salish Territory fisherman on her father’s side, and her designs for EMME Studio often reflect that legacy. She is known for crafting beautiful jackets and shirts in bright sunset and oceanic colors, and in patterns that pay homage to the sacred relationship between humans and animals. Celebrities and politicians like Deb Haaland have worn Emmerich’s designs, and one of her creations, a wool skirt and coat, was even featured in the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s “In America: A Lexicon of Fashion” exhibit. At the height of the pandemic, Emmerich used her sartorial skills to help her community by crafting hundreds of face masks in traditional patterns and hues. “[Indigenous] masks can carry heavy ceremonial responsibilities in recovery and healing,” Emmerich told ELLE at the time. “Everything created is meant to be used and masks help share traditional teachings in a sort of theatrical way.”
Lauren Good Day, an Arikara-Hidatsa-Blackfeet-Plains-Cree designer, learned beadwork from her mother as a child. She then took that passion for art and traditional design and incorporated it into her eponymous contemporary clothing brand, which is known worldwide for its bright unisex graphic tees, hoodies, and pants. Her latest collection honors the “aesthetic of the flourishing Northern Plains” and features traditional floral and elk patterns in bright colors.
Growing up on the Wind River Reservation in Wyoming, Keri Ataumbi developed a love for contemporary Native American design at an early age. The Kiowa fine jeweler categorizes her work as “wearable art,” because it incorporates conceptual narrative and often features juxtaposing materials. “In the Western world, there’s been a real separation in terms of what’s art and what isn’t art,” she said in an interview. “There’s not an integrated feeling about jewelry, that jewelry is actually art and can have all the same stories and potency that a painting does.”  
Renowned beadworker Jamie Okuma is thoughtful and eco-conscious when she comes up with her luxury designs—which often incorporate intricate patterns of florals and animals. Okuma—who is Luiseño, Shoshone-Bannock, Wailaki, and Okinawan—keeps production quantity relatively low in order to avoid overstock. “We all have those go-to pieces in our closet that we keep for years and literally wear out before we retire them,” she said in an interview. “I’m here to make the go-tos, the keepers.”
Lesley Hampton, who landed a spot on ELLE Canada’s list of designers to watch, credits her Anishinaabe and Mohawk heritage for shaping her work. Hampton’s sleek designs, which bring to light issues like mental health via phrases and sayings emblazoned on them, have been spotted on runways and red carpets (Lizzo is a fan). But that’s not why Hampton got into fashion. “I’ve been doing a lot of growing up and discovering my Indigeneity,” she told ELLE Canada. “I use the collection as a catalyst for figuring out my identity. Being able to present that with beautiful garments on the runway is just a bonus.”
Jamie Gentry is from the Kwakwaka’wakw Nation, and grew up immersed in a world full of traditional culture and art—particularly sewing, beading, and weaving. She took that deep-rooted passion for all things handmade and turned it into a bona fide bespoke moccasin-making business. Each pair is custom-made and, Gentry says on her site, says “infused with love.”
As a teenager, Tania Larsson immersed herself in her Gwich’in culture—teaching herself how to make traditional jewelry and beaded garments. She found a mentor in Ataumbi, featured above on this list. After apprenticing under the designer for two years, Larsson began making her own beautiful jewelry under her brand Gwich’in Fine Jewellery, which she described in an interview as “a conduit that creates connections between the land, animals, elders, hunters, community members, and the wearer.” 
Fast fashion didn’t suit artistic designer Amy Denet Deal. So in 2018, she left her corporate fashion job in Los Angeles and headed to New Mexico. Inspired by the sense of sustainability of her native Navajo community, Deal launched 4KINSHIP as a woman-led “artwear” brand focused on upcycling and producing one-of-a-kind clothing and accessories and uplifting Indigenous communities, particularly those in the Southwest where 4KINSHIP is based. She also founded the 4KINSHIP Indigenous Futures Fund to help incubate emerging talents and encourage Native creativity and expression. 
ThunderVoice Hat Co. is one of Denet Deal’s personal favorites for its “exquisite upcycled luxury products.” ThunderVoice does offer an array of high-end hats and jewelry, but you can also find a wide variety of smaller items that would be perfect for gifting, like stickers, pins, and fanny packs. One thing that is particularly special at TVHC is the art. You can find classic works like “Girl With a Pearl Earring”  and “American Gothic” reimagined through a Native American lens. The results are stunning. 
There’s only one Indigenous denim brand in the entire world—one!—and it’s Ginew. This brand takes modern Native American style and adds inflections of Ojibwe, Oneida, Stockbridge-Munsee motifs. All of Ginew’s apparel and goods are made of the highest quality and with the utmost care and tradition. All leather goods are made with pre-industrial techniques informed by generations of craftsmanship.  
From northern Arizona’s Diné (Navajo) people, comes Di’Orr Greenwood. Greenwood specializes in hand making bespoke wooden flutes, skateboard decks, and longboards. Her designs are colorful and, more importantly, meaningful. “Any art that comes from me is definitely ancestral based,” she said in a Navajo Times interview. “It’s more of a feeling.” Themes and symbols Greenwood incorporates include the four directions, elements, mountains, and the seasons. 
Rose is a Senior Editor at ELLE overseeing features and projects about women's issues. She is an accomplished and compassionate storyteller and editor who excels in obtaining exclusive interviews and unearthing compelling features. 
 
Meg is the Associate Fashion Commerce Editor at ELLE.com where she researches trends, tests products, and looks for answers to all your burning questions. She also co-writes a monthly column, Same Same But Different. Meg has previously written for Cosmopolitan and Town & Country. Her passions include travel, buffalo sauce, and sustainability. She will never stop hoping for a One Direction reunion tour.

title: Pisces Weekly Horoscope
text:
(February 19 - March 20)
Your friends and colleagues are your lifeline, but signals (and connections) may have been strained over the past five months as intensifying Pluto idled in a frustrating retrograde through your eleventh house of teamwork and technology (since May 1). But on Tuesday, October 10, the cathartic planet resumes forward movement, bringing more clarity and stability to your social life. (This can also clear up some of those mysterious tech issues you’ve experienced!) You’ll feel more connected to your inner circle and might want to get to know a co-worker better. Part of Pluto’s “curriculum” has been to show you, firsthand, who you do—and DON’T—have the time or energy for anymore. The eleventh house rules all kinds of groups and communities, and if you’ve been dabbling on the sidelines with one or a few special-interest groups, take a leap of faith and get more involved. As you feel your way into different organizations, it won’t take long to know whether you’re ready to commit to full-fledged membership or not.
A heavy emotional weight begins to lift this Thursday as activator Mars pulls up stakes in Libra and your eighth house of secrets, seduction and jealousy, where it’s been since August 27, and charges into Scorpio and your liberated, expansive ninth house until November 24. Scorpio is a fellow water sign, and it’s co-ruled by Mars, so these next six weeks could be intense. Motivated Mars in this unrepressed zone can help you shake off any gloomy or negative feelings of the past month and a half. If possessiveness or distrust have been holding you back, you may find a new lightness around your heart center. Since the ninth house also rules travel, foreign cultures and higher education, interactions with different types of people will be especially stimulating for you over the next six weeks. Don’t be surprised if you’re drawn to folks from very different backgrounds or whose lifestyles are wildly divergent from yours. That’s what makes life interesting—and creates chemistry! If you’re in a committed union, you can spark a romantic revival by adding more adventure to your life. Challenge yourself (safely) with a hiking trip, an adventure-themed getaway or by enrolling in a month-long boot camp—together. Or take the same week off from work and plan a super-fun staycation, with each of you planning little surprises for the other.
Both of the week’s major themes—transformation and relationship—get supercharged on Saturday, courtesy of an annular “ring of fire” solar eclipse/new moon in Libra and your eighth house of metaphysics and intimacy. While you may not have been able to articulate it, you’ve had a growing sense that a certain area of your life was in need of a deep change. This new eclipse cycle, on the Aries-Libra axis, began last April 20 (and is in effect until March 29, 2025), and you might have been feeling the rumblings. And shifts are imminent! Over the next two weeks, as the moon wanes, you’ll have increasingly clearer glimpses of what needs your attention—and HOW you can initiate or accelerate the process. Be patient with yourself, Pisces. Eclipses’ sphere of influence lasts six months, so give yourself time to do the slow, lasting work that will support your big decision. And since the eighth house rules shared resources, a fringe benefit of all your inner work could be taking a committed next step with bae… or meeting someone with the potential for permabonding.

title: Aquarius Weekly Horoscope
text:
(January 20 - February 18)
Until this Tuesday, October 10, you may not have realized just how deeply and intensely buried emotions, old wounds and unresolved issues have been affecting you, Water Bearer. But this week, one of the main instigators of that, alchemist Pluto, wraps up an unnerving five-month retrograde through your twelfth house of the unconscious, healing and mysticism. Now that the cathartic dwarf planet is back in forward motion, you’re ready to finish the curriculum, learn the big lessons, and release any resentment, grief or pain. But make sure you’ve become conversant with what those feelings are and how they function inside your psyche. If you’ve been doing ANY kind of inner process work—psychological, spiritual or around addiction—you’re already way ahead of the game. And for Aquarians who are hesitant (or straight-up resistant) to “going there,” remember that whatever you tell yourself, you’ve still got a powerful metaphysical side. And as Pluto gains momentum and pushes full steam ahead, you could find yourself open to some very different ideas—and people. Don’t be surprised if boundaries blur or you’re suddenly willing to ease up a bit on any death-grip control.
Work is a perfect arena to channel this renewed energy starting on Thursday, when action planet Mars charges into Scorpio and your tenth house of success until November 24. While others are off leaf-peeping and apple-picking, you’re just getting going on a major project. Set your sights on the juiciest goal you’ve been dreaming of while Pluto was retrograde and map out your first key steps. You won’t have to twist any arms or cajole anyone into teaming up with you: Your work ethic, talent and innovative style will make you a force to be reckoned with over the coming six weeks. If you’ve been eyeing a leadership position, let the appropriate decision-makers know. On the other hand, if you’re not happy with your current gig, double down on your job-searching efforts—discreetly! Stand out from the pack by putting personal touches on your resume, portfolio, reel or professional profiles to make them memorable. If you’re an entrepreneur, this is a perfect time to invest in the business by expanding PR, marketing or online advertising.
Get as much momentum going as you can right out of the gate, Aquarius, because Saturday’s annular “ring of fire” solar eclipse/new moon in Libra activates your ninth house of global adventures, which could bring your simmering wanderlust to a full boil. While it’s great to have your professional mojo back, there’s another side of you that can’t keep away from travel blogs and hunting for last-minute deals. Where have you been fantasizing about? Which far-flung friend has been trying to lure you to their neck of the woods? These next few weeks are an auspicious time for doing anything expansive, so even if you can’t book a trip now, you can scratch that travel itch by planning it or simply engaging in cross-cultural connections. Eclipses reveal what’s hiding in the shadows, so be careful what you wish for. With this eclipse cycle in effect from April 20, 2023, to March 29, 2025, your independent spirit needs room to roam. An essential component is being honest about your needs and desires. So if something’s not sitting right with you, swallow the truth serum and broach the tough topic within two weeks of the eclipse. You can’t change the status quo until you confront it directly.

title: Capricorn Weekly Horoscope
text:
(December 22 - January 19)
Ready, set, exhale! Finally, after five frustrating months, cathartic Pluto ends its retrograde and resumes forward motion in your sign on Tuesday, October 10. Since May 1, you may have felt like someone (or something) was personally out to slow you down or hold you back, but that’s about to change immediately! Even if you got in a rut and have been spinning your wheels, you can thrust ahead and quickly gain momentum by boldly stepping into your power and being seen and heard. Your gusto will be infectious and help you make up for what seems like lost time. As things pick up speed and begin to soar over the next seven months, continually check in with yourself to make sure you’re acting authentically from the heart. You’ll have to shed any emotional armor you acquired during Pluto’s retrograde, even when you feel vulnerable. But ultimately, that’s a sign NOT of weakness but of strength and confidence. And with direct-moving Pluto in your corner, you have the secret ingredient for success!
The same week that Pluto corrects course, Mars does a “costume change” of its own, exiting Libra and your professional sector and marching into Scorpio and your eleventh house of group activities until November 24. Part of you is happiest (and feels safest) working on your own. But because you probably won’t always be able to work solo, it’s important to sharpen your interpersonal communication skills for when you are part of a team. Mars and Pluto co-rule Scorpio, and their mutual moves can highlight themes of power, cooperation and the need to align over shared values. Over the next six weeks, you can become more adept at navigating what might be a minefield. First: Do an attitude assessment. If you have a belief (conscious or not) that working with others requires you to give up your personal power, stop right there and reframe it so you can focus on the strength—and talent pool—that’s found in numbers. No one excels at everything, Capricorn, and where you’re a little weak, someone else might be a rock star, and their knowledge and expertise can actually make YOU smarter! You may have to share the glory, but there’s more than enough to go around!
And speaking of kudos… Saturday’s annular “ring of fire” solar eclipse/new moon in your career corner could bring rapid—and highly visible—developments at work, your favorite kind! Now, to reach that next level of success you may have to stretch and pivot in new ways and at a more rapid pace than you’re used to. But that’s what “advancement” is all about! You’ve got major eclipse mojo working for you, so trust the process, be ready to act and resist the default “overthinking” that comes with Capricorn territory. Assume that a plum opportunity is waiting for you. Dress for success—i.e., the job you WANT to have—and self-promote on social media, set up power lunches and conference calls, and let your voice be heard in meetings. Shoptalk isn’t restricted to the office or “9-5,” either. You could have a serendipitous meeting with a stranger who turns out to be the perfect connection for your career. But you won’t find out if you don’t stick your neck out a bit!

title: Sagittarius Weekly Horoscope
text:
(November 22 - December 21)
If you’ve struggled to keep your head above water for the past five months—or sunk into a sea of debt—the universe throws you a lifeline this week. (Or at least you’ll find it easier to stay afloat.) This Tuesday, October 10, shadowy Pluto resumes forward motion after a long, frustrating retrograde through your financial zone. But don’t expect money to fall out of the sky. You still have to do your bit, and right now is the perfect moment to re-commit to managing your cash flow in a more positive way while also finding a way to boost your bottom line. Do a little “damage assessment,” Sag: Are you underpaid and underappreciated and ready to start earning what you deserve? You know what you’re worth, but it can be daunting to try to persuade the people who sign your paycheck to bump up your pay. But if you “can’t” and they “won’t,” then it’s time to start hunting for a new job. Pluto will gain momentum as it marches forward over these next seven months, meaning it’s your job to make yourself indispensable and irreplaceable. (Of course, no one needs to know you’re discreetly circulating your resume at the same time.) While your indie-spirited sign isn’t generally a fan of following rules, you can—and should—be working the Law of Attraction!
Keep your motivation high even when your energy dips. That may be the case starting this Thursday as go-getter Mars slips out of your social sector and under the covers in your internally focused twelfth house until November 24. Every other year, the action planet goes underground for six or seven weeks, and that can induce YOU to go off the radar. That may or may not be possible, but honor the urge by giving yourself plenty of downtime by day, and allowing extra dreamtime by night since the twelfth house is where you receive divine downloads. When you’re not in the mood to be social, don’t force yourself—and don’t let anyone guilt-trip you into doing what doesn’t feel right. Trust the process! Since this realm is also associated with closure, release and transitions, you may finally be ready to quit a bad habit—or a toxic relationship. Get the support you need by surrounding yourself with positive people and maybe working with a therapist or coach. By resting, recharging and healing, you’ll come out more creatively inspired than ever, more than ready for Mars-in-Sag season on November 24.
Even when you’re on your personal retreat, you’ll want to reach out to your inner circle. But this introspective period might have you reconsidering certain members (er, hangers-on?) in your social network. On Saturday, an annular (“ring of fire”) solar eclipse/new moon in Libra—the first one in this sign since 2016—turns the spotlight on your eleventh house of group activity. As a Sagittarius, you can’t help but draw the eclectic people wherever you go, but not all of them deserve your time and attention. Solar eclipses are like new moons on steroids, so there could be some radical new beginnings with your squad mates. “Pruning your garden” is one thing, but if you pool your talents and resources, what exciting venture might some of you create as a collab? Assemble your dream team or plan an event where you can play superconnector and bring everyone together. Eclipses reveal hidden opportunities, and since this one lands in your tech sector, you could serendipitously meet a new collaborator through social media. Click and ye shall find!

title: Scorpio Weekly Horoscope
text:
(October 23 - November 21)
Have you been trying to read the tea leaves, Scorpio, only to be stuck attempting to decode all kinds of cryptic messages and ambiguous subtexts? You can let that go on Tuesday, October 10, as transformational Pluto—your cosmic co-ruler—ends a frustrating five-month retrograde in your third house of communication. As the mighty dwarf planet resumes forward motion, you’ll be back to your old incisive self, able to read people without said tea leaves or coffee grounds or even a divination deck. Better yet? The gift of this Plutonian dive into the underworld (i.e., reverse pivot) is that you may have a stronger and clearer message to share, AND you may finally have found the confidence to shout it from the rooftops (or perhaps your social media channels). While you’re at it, how about cherry-picking a few select people and inviting them into your inner sanctum? Trust can be challenging for many Scorpios, but the number one way to get over that is to open up to a few people who’ve shown their loyalty and responsibility, and mutually proving that you have each other’s backs.
On Thursday, you might not be able to hold yourself back from blasting ahead. This star-powered day has been two years in the making! Your OTHER co-ruler, go-getter Mars, busts out of the private twelfth-house chrysalis it’s been since August 27 and charges into your sign until November 24. As Mars returns to Scorpio, you’ll experience an energizing burst of motivation, which will supercharge your ambitions and fill you with can-do spirit for the next six weeks. Mars only comes around every two years, but when he marches through your sign, you WILL feel it! Forget hiding out in the shadows, like you may have done while Mars was holed up in your introspective twelfth house. Now’s the time to step off the sidelines and get 100 percent back in the game. Good luck trying hide that legendary Scorpio charisma and animal magnetism. Just one word of caution: Stay mindful of where you’re aiming your beams. It could be easier to draw someone in than disconnect from them when you’re ready to move on.
But leave plenty of white space in your calendar, Scorpio. Saturday’s annular (“ring of fire”) solar eclipse/new moon in Libra powers up your twelfth house of endings and transitions, unofficially dubbing this your “sweet surrender” time. You’re not a big fan of “letting to,” but this is a rare and potent opportunity to loosen up your death grip on the control panel and yield to—or set an intention to co-create with—a higher force. You might feel righteously indignant at someone, but hanging onto anger or resentment only hurts YOU. While you may never condone or accept their actions, forgiveness is always an option—and it’s one of the most important steps to true healing and lasting change. This is a great time to focus on strengthening your sense of self and establishing firmer boundaries, which support all future relationships. And you don’t have to DIY! Work with a coach or therapist or find a simpatico support group to help you move past any grief, anxiety or fear. Easy it’s not, but the payoff could literally change your life during this eclipse cycle, which is galvanizing the Aries-Libra axis from April 20, 2023, until March 29, 2025. Let it go so you can grow!

title: Libra Weekly Horoscope
text:
(September 23 - October 22)
If “confusion and chaos” has been a more accurate description of your domestic life than “home sweet home” over the past five months, get ready for a major sea change. This Tuesday, October 10, radical Pluto wraps up the retrograde in your fourth house of home and family that began May 1. This may explain why things on the Libra home front have been anything but calm and even-tempered. Roommates, relatives, children and even landlords have taken turns acting disruptively, the cumulative effect of which may have sent you into a frustration spiral. But now, with Pluto’s course correction, it’s safe to come out of hiding. And auspicious timing because you may have a big decision looming around home, family and where you live. Just lean into your natural Libran quest for balance and you’ll find a harmonious solution to any problem. Even if your domestic life has been serene, relations with a certain relative may have gotten strained. With Pluto back to forward motion, you’ll have the perfect opening to extend an olive branch—AND proactively get some stricter boundaries in place!
Thursday’s skies bring more good news—specifically a boon for your bottom line! Things will start to look up, fiscally speaking, from now until November 24, as hard-driving Mars races through Scorpio and your second house of money and security. This monetary uptick is welcome news, even if it means the enlivening red planet is leaving your sign for another two years. You’ve been hosting Mars since August 27, which has been energizing AND nerve-racking since the competitive warrior planet isn’t at his most comfortable in your cooperative, peace-loving sign. Hopefully you got the kind of motivational jolt you need to move into this next revenue-boosting phase. Now, as Mars enters his home sign of Scorpio, you’ll be in a position to come up with a practical plan for last month’s brainstorms. But pace yourself, Libra. Mars’ M.O. is to come on strong and act impulsively, which could lead you to do things you could regret later. Be sure to keep a mindful eye on your spending, which can balloon out of control with Mars at the helm.
On Saturday, a “ring of fire” (annular) solar eclipse/new moon in Libra sounds the starting bell for a new beginning…on anything your heart desires! But take note: You may have to come crawling out from behind the scenes and step into the spotlight. Dust yourself off and get used to it. This is the first eclipse to activate your sign since 2016! And while it might feel like the ground’s moving beneath your feet, that might be exactly what it takes to put yourself out there again. It’s not an ego trip, Libra—at least, it doesn’t HAVE to be. (And knowing you, it won’t be.) Think of it this way: By sharing your progress and accomplishments, you can inspire others to work harder on THEIRS. Make this an integral part of your message. When you’re promoting your offerings, emphasize the benefits for other people. As your partnership-oriented sign knows well, the best things in life are always mutual.

title: Virgo Weekly Horoscope
text:
(August 23 - September 22)
Hit the reset button on your love life, Virgo! This Tuesday, October 10, transformative Pluto resumes forward motion in your fifth house of passion, fame and amour after five frustrating months of idling in neutral there. But as that annoying retrograde comes to an end and the penetrating dwarf planet blasts ahead, you won’t be deterred by the speed bumps and potholes that have slowed your roll since May 1. Some Virgos may still be a little nauseous from that emotional roller-coaster ride. But now, with Pluto back on track, you can recalibrate your romantic radar. Set an intention for what kind of partner or upgraded relationship you want to manifest this year. You may need to step outside your comfort zone and experiment with new approaches to meeting prospects, whether that means trying a new dating app or asking friends to make introductions. Should you go that route, be more open-minded about your pursuits. Screen carefully and with typical Virgo discernment, but give the “maybes” more of a fighting chance. Couples can revive their vibe by exploring some new terrain, whether in a couples’ massage class or a sexy beach getaway.
If you’re single, don’t categorically rule out ALL platonic connections as potentials. On Thursday, seductive Mars blasts into hot-blooded Scorpio and your third house of local friends and community until November 24, putting you in fine flirting form. This gives you a bone-deep confidence to go after what your heart desires. Deal with any remnants of self-consciousness or guilt that come up—assuming they’re misbegotten! We realize that not all Virgos are comfortable articulating romantic interest, so lean into your natural superpowers of keen observation and a quick wit. But don’t get carried away by leading someone on who you’re not into in, and by all means, steer clear of too-easy snark and sarcasm. (A double risk with hotheaded Mars in the picture.) Get 100 percent clear on the difference between teasing and being mean, and stop far short of crossing that line. With your communicative third house activated, your Virgo mind will be razor-sharp, making this a great time for any writing, media or teaching projects.
The universe wants to show YOU the money this Saturday as the annular (“ring of fire”) solar eclipse/new moon in Libra electrifies your second house of money. If you’ve been waiting for news on a big pitch or job offer, be ready to pounce. Your phone could start blowing up with promising opportunities for big paydays now or over the next two weeks (peak manifesting time). Eclipses reveal what’s been hidden—sometimes in plain sight. If you haven’t been happy with the status quo, start poking around in the shadows! Should something new come your way, don’t worry about not acing it on first try—a tendency of your perfectionistic sign. Just say yes, be patient (easy for your humble sign) and plan to learn on the job. This fiscally auspicious eclipse gives you the nerve to raise your rate or request a pay increase, so get a meeting on the books with the folks who sign your paycheck.

title: Leo Weekly Horoscope
text:
Every item on this page was chosen by an ELLE editor. We may earn commission on some of the items you choose to buy.
(July 23 - August 22)
Has the wellness wagon passed you by…again? Don’t despair, Leo. You may finally be ready to hop aboard! After five unnerving months spinning retrograde in your sixth house of healthy living, organization and service, transformational Pluto resumes forward motion this Tuesday, October 10. Whether you were idling in neutral or slipping into old habits, the place to start is by accepting wherever you’re at now and concocting a new game plan. But easy does it! You can’t go from full-on decadence to Olympian overnight. And make sure you’re being realistic about what your ultimate goal is. Not sure where to begin? Nutrition is always a good idea. Slow, steady steps in a greener direction will make you feel better, give you more energy and build momentum toward larger changes. Then commit to moving your body on a regular basis. Find exercise or movement classes that genuinely excite you—maybe a fun barre or dance-based workout? Pluto’s pivot forward also supports you in organizing your daily routines and streamlining your systems. If you know there are certain chores you always resist, for whatever reason, figure out if you can outsource them.
Love to entertain? Then make sure Chez Leo is up to snuff because over the next six weeks, your lair could become a buzzing social hive. This Thursday, passionate Mars blasts into intense Scorpio and your domestic fourth house until November 24, turning up the heat on all home-based activities. And YOU get to decide what those functions will be. What do you need to do ASAP to get your place party-ready? Are you up for a major cleanup and decluttering mission? Restock the fridge and pantry, dust off your board games, download some appropriate playlists and go pull some cute cozy season ‘fits. On the plus side, Mars will motivate and energize you…but it can also churn up competitive and even aggressive vibes with some people. So the heads-up is to make a point of limiting your exposure to the divas and high-maintenance folks in your circle. If you’ve been considering a move, the red planet can spark a fire in your belly and keep it lit for six weeks. Speaking of keeping the home fires burning, lusty Mars intensifies your desire to play house with bae or, if you’re single, get serious about meeting someone. Don’t reflexively reject the “nice” guys or girls. They can be surprisingly hot when you get to know them.
But keep your guard up this weekend. Saturday’s annular (“ring of fire”) solar eclipse/new moon in Libra powers up your house of friendship, and since eclipses reveal hidden information, you could learn something unpleasant about a person you considered a BFF. This eclipse cycle—which is galvanizing the Aries-Libra axis from April 20, 2023, to March 29, 2025—might expose a fair-weather friend or opportunist. If you do discover something unsavory, don’t ignore it. Before you read anyone to filth, however, make sure you’ve got all the facts. Surprises aren’t always bad. You might find out that unbeknownst to you, someone has been going to bat on your behalf. This is also your realm of siblings, and over the next two weeks, you could resolve a long-standing issue with one of yours. Amen to that!

title: Cancer Weekly Horoscope
text:
(June 21 - July 22)
Relationship refresh! You may feel like your love life is catching a cosmic tailwind starting on Tuesday, October 10, and amen to that! Transformational Pluto resumes forward motion after a seemingly endless (but really just five-month) retrograde in your dynamic-duos sector. Some Crabs grappled with heavy issues, sending you down a frustrating rabbit hole. For others, an important relationship may have hit the skids, or you couldn’t figure out if a certain someone was worth moving forward with. Now, as Pluto straightens out, clarity and optimism will return, laying the tracks for progress in your partnerships. Whether you’re making some necessary adjustments or doing a hard reset, don’t underestimate the primacy of being totally honest about your needs—with other people AND yourself. HOW you communicate those desires is even more important. In a new situationship? Tap the brakes and don’t be too available. It’s not manipulative to slow down and let desire build. Anticipation makes the payoff that much sweeter!
Lending support on this front is passionate Mars, who blasts into intense Scorpio and your fifth house of romance, fame and creativity on Thursday for six weeks. Your prickly protective shell may be easily removed by the right person! From now until November 24, you’ll be the life of every party, turning heads wherever you strut. It’s a safe bet that your love life won’t lack for drama! This frame of mind may feel uncharacteristically forward, but whenever it does strike, you’re actually quite skillful at taking the lead. This makes it more essential that you know exactly what you’re looking for, whether a sizzling no-strings fling or a union with the potential to go the distance. And don’t forget to let the object of your affection know what’s in your heart. Watch out for Mars’ tendency to come on too strong. Candid and direct are fine, but maintain a modicum of mystery to keep them intrigued! If you’re an artist or performer, this is your cue to put yourself out there. This Martian power surge could get your name on the map before Thanksgiving!
Save some energy and bandwidth for your kith and kin, though! Saturday’s annular “ring of fire” solar eclipse in Libra powers up your domestic fourth house and could signal some changes in your home environment. This is a new moon, and that monthly phase is associated with beginnings. Caveat: Decisions made under an eclipse tend to come with a “plot twist,” especially if you don’t peer around into the shadows, so really think through the worst-case scenarios. Have you been considering inviting a new roommate (or partner) into your lair? Maybe a relative needs more support—or LESS? But if you give away too much of your time, space or freedom, you stand to ruin a great friendship or romance if you’re not careful. If you’ve been dreaming about a move—to a warmer or cheaper clime or more culturally diverse locale—get familiar with real estate websites and listings. And to the degree you can, check out the area IRL, too. Happy where you are? Could Chez Crab use a little zhushing to make it all the sweeter? You’ve got six months after this eclipse to manifest, so start making mood boards ASAP.

title: Gemini Weekly Horoscope
text:
(May 21 - June 20)
Ready for some levity, Gemini? Of course you are! And lightness and ease are scheduled to return this Tuesday, October 10, as penetrating Pluto, which has spent the past five (exhausting) months back-spinning through your eighth house of intense emotions, seduction and shared resources, finally corrects course. Some Geminis may come out of this relatively “unscathed” while others will be radically transformed. Whatever your situation, this is a good week to take a moment to assess the shifts and stress-test your foundation to ensure your structure is intact—then you can start to think about goals and what’s next. Honor the new depths through which you may have experienced life—meaning, don’t just dust yourself off and pick up where you left off before Pluto’s retrograde. Think of these hard-won lessons as your badges, and it can only be helpful to process what you’ve learned and all the ways you’ve grown over these possibly challenging five months. Whether you dealt with someone’s unsavory behavior or your own abandonment issues, consider it a major victory because it’s only when we courageously confront our personal demons that we can truly understand ourselves and our deepest desires.
Pluto’s power plays notwithstanding, the past six weeks may have felt like one endless party, and now you’re ready to bring order to the Gemini court. In a stroke of perfect timing, on Thursday, go-getter Mars blasts into Scorpio and your sixth house of work, service, organization and healthy living until November 24. This can bring the kind of laser-like focus and stick-with-it-ness your mercurial sign can struggle to find. Mars in its “second home” sign of Scorpio intensifies your drive and lends so much world-class perseverance that you’ll actually be motivated push yourself harder than you’re used to. Just don’t slip into Scorpio-style obsessiveness. “Extreme moderation” is plenty! At work, you’ll be unstoppable over these next six weeks. Set some ambitious (yet realistic) goals that will ensure you end the year strong. It’s not just about crossing the finish line: You want to get there first—AND with your integrity intact. Competitive Mars might tempt you to take a shortcut, but if your heart tells you that would be a hollow victory, resist the temptation!
This weekend is all about the sizzle. On Saturday, an annular “ring of fire” solar eclipse/new moon in fellow air sign Libra electrifies your passionate fifth house, amplifying your creative and romantic juices. Eclipses expose what’s been in the shadows, and this one could reveal a treasure trove of buried desires. This eclipse cycle—which started on April 20 and lasts until March 29, 2025—is galvanizing the Aries-Libra axis and its theme of independence and cooperation. And for you, Gem, as Saturday’s moonbeams start working their magic, you won’t be interested in compromising your standards or putting up with immature behavior from a halfhearted lover. Single? Be ready at a moment’s notice because Cupid could pay an unannounced visit within two weeks, and to gain the gifts of this eclipse, you’ll have to make a quick decision. Give a promising budding connection a chance to take root—you’ll never discover its highest potential if you don’t go all in. And since the fifth house rules fame, these next two weeks (peak manifesting time for this lunation) could bring some unanticipated recognition for your talents. Bottom line: This is NOT the time to try to dodge the spotlight, so step into it proudly!

title: Taurus Weekly Horoscope
text:
(April 20 - May 20)
As much as you love your routines and sense of security, Bull, sometimes a case of wanderlust is all it takes to send you racing off for new vistas. And that may be the case this Tuesday, October 10, as transformational Pluto ends its five-month retrograde through your ninth house of adventure and global expansion. Whether you literally felt your wings were clipped or this cycle has been one long “psychic hibernation,” the net result could very well have left you with cabin fever. The best way to overcome inertia and stuckness is by picking one or two new pursuits and lunging into them! It matters far less what they ARE than whether they’re juicy enough to get your imagination cranking and your body moving. The ninth house is about stretching out of your comfort zone and expanding your horizons, literally and figuratively. If you’ve got a vacay on the books or can pull one off quickly, that would be ideal. If not, simply researching a bucket-list trip—like a yoga or writing retreat or a voluntourism experience—can get your blood pumping. Closer to home, you can scratch that itch at the library, indie bookstores or any of your town’s myriad cultural options. Take the Plutonian lessons you learned (or are still downloading) from this dive into life’s shadow side and test the limits of your wingspan!
Romance reboot: coming right up! On Thursday, passionate Mars blasts into Scorpio and your seventh house of relationships until November 24. For the next six weeks, your focus will be on the key connections in your life, both of a personal and professional nature. If you’re in an LTR, this is a great time to rekindle the sexy sparks or do something together that you’ve never done to get the blood pumping. If you’re single or in a “too soon to call it” situation, stop to ask yourself some big-picture questions, starting with, what kind of partner do you WANT? Mars is the action planet, and in this position, it can trigger necessary changes, but it still falls to YOU to enact them. With the lusty planet making tracks in this realm, you might find your thirst is spiking—bordering on insatiably—so take the steps to bring satisfaction. You may have to try some new approaches, but if the tried and true aren’t delivering results, it’s worth a shot.
One thing you can do on your own that’s good for your love life and your sense of adventure is improve your health and vitality. And perfect timing: On Saturday, an annular solar eclipse/new moon in Libra electrifies your sixth house of wellness (and work and service). Considering that autumn has just kicked off (in the Northern hemisphere), it’s not too late to start your own fall training, so join a new gym, buy a yoga package or find another way to commit to regular exercise. And since you are what you eat, do a proper inspection of what’s been going into your mouth lately. You may decide to cut out sugary snacks, gluten or alcohol, but be sure to replace those mood boosters with healthier things that also nourish you, including movement. This eclipse cycle—which is galvanizing the Aries-Libra axis—started on April 20 and lasts until March 29, 2025. Start looking at all the ways that you need to clean up your act a little for the sake of honoring your own well-being!

title: Aries Weekly Horoscope
text:
(March 21 - April 19)
Ready for a professional reboot? One is queued up to kick in any time starting this Tuesday, October 10, as potent transformer Pluto returns to forward motion in your career sector after a lethargic five-month retrograde. Slowdowns, setbacks and deep introspection may have been the major theme of your work life during that time. After five months in low gear, you’re ready to blast ahead. From now until next May, you’ll be drawing from a bottomless well of inspiration—and opportunities. As Pluto dances back and forth across the Capricorn-Aquarius border for the next 13 months, you’ve got a chance to go really big with your dreams, pitches and proposals. Reach out to the power players with your best material. And before Pluto moves into Aquarius and your eleventh house of colleagues and cohorts on January 20, take some time to envision your dream team of collaborators, mentors and coaches. Not only will you want to surround yourself with them, but you may need to lean on them a bit in your climb to the top.
More exciting shifts are in store this week, with a highlight coming on Thursday. That day—and stretching until November 24—your galactic guardian, impassioned Mars blasts into Scorpio and your erotic and intimate eighth house. This should bring the sizzle and seduction you’ve been craving. If you’re in a committed union, this can rekindle sparks and possibly inspire you to pool resources you’ve kept separate. But if you’re unattached or in a too-new-to-call-it situationship, take a minute to get clear about what you truly desire in a partner. Your wishes, coupled with a clear vision, will help you manifest what’s in your heart. Bear in mind that in Scorpio, the lusty red planet can turn up the heat AND stir up strong emotions as well as trust issues. What do you need to feel comfortable in a close relationship? And for some Aries, the million-dollar question: Do you even want commitment? The one thing Mars unequivocally demands is authenticity.
The feels are out in spades this Saturday as an annular “ring of fire” solar eclipse/new moon in Libra electrifies in your seventh house of partnerships. This could take a just-getting-off-the-ground connection and turn it into something mind-blowing—or it might open a tinderbox of intense emotions you’ve never experienced. If you’ve been keeping a secret crush to yourself, speak up! You might be pleasantly surprised to learn the attraction is mutual. Solar eclipses (new moons) signal beginnings, but sometimes they signal the beginning of the END of something that’s reached its expiration date. If you’ve been waiting for a sign that it’s time to move on, this eclipse could bring it. But take the next two weeks to really think it through so you don’t—whoops!—make a decision you’ll live to regret. This eclipse cycle is galvanizing the Aries-Libra axis from April 20 until March 29, 2025. If everything’s rock-solid, perhaps it’s time to put a literal rock on THAT finger…this could be one of the happy revelations this Libra solar eclipse brings.

title: Pisces Daily Horoscope
text:
(February 19 - March 20)
There’s no blame in this game, Pisces. Under today’s stern skies, it’s hard not to point fingers, but you’ll get farther if you’re willing to examine your own issues. Amiable Venus in your relationship realm glides into an opposition with harsh Saturn in your sign, casting a critical cloud over your one-to-one connections. You may be convinced that you’re in the right and your behavior is justified. But try putting yourself in the other person’s fashionable fall boots. When you lean in to your innate empathy, you’ll be able to imagine why they feel the way they feel. Can’t quite get there? Even if you can’t understand their POV, tell them you respect their position.

title: Israel-Palestine: How to Help the Victims of Yesterday’s Deadly Attack
text:
A list of organizations offering relief to those in need and working toward peace.
Hamas, a Palestinian militant group, launched an attack on Israel this Saturday, firing at least 2,200 rockets into the country and adding 500 or more to the death toll in a war that has carried on for decades. 
The Israeli Defense Forces, in return, declared a state of war and retaliated with airstrikes. 
Bloodshed is not something to take sides in. And a conflict that has gone on for centuries, killed millions of innocent families, and wreaked religious, political, and economic havoc in two populations, can only be described as a catastrophe that must find its resolution. 
Below, a list of organizations calling for peace and helping the victims of this war.
ALLMEP is the largest network of Palestinian and Israeli peace builders. Donate here.
The Carter Center has been promoting peace in Israel and Palestine since the 1990s. “Through election observation, conflict resolution, and human rights work in the occupied Palestinian territory, The Carter Center has developed strong relations among key Israeli and Palestinian political leaders, electoral officials, civil society leaders, and human rights practitioners,” they say. Donate to their cause here.
The United Nations remains a neutral organization aiming to bring peace between the two territories. Donate here.
The International Red Cross provides assistance during times of crisis, and has pleaded for an end to the violence between Israel and Palestine. “In our role as a neutral intermediary, we are ready to visit anyone detained so we can check on their well-being and provide news to their loved ones,” the organization says. Help here.
Doctors Without Borders provides immediate medical aid during humanitarian emergencies. Help them save lives here.
International Medical Corps works with local health agencies and partners to provide emergency health services, gender-based violence services, and COVID-19 prevention services. Donate here.
Save the Children is providing resources to affected children. Donate here.
Direct Relief provides medical resources in vulnerable communities worldwide. Help here.
The International Rescue Committee is assessing needs on the ground and the organization’s capacity to ensure critical, life-saving humanitarian relief reaches affected civilian populations. Donate here. 
Rosa Sanchez is the senior news editor at Harper's Bazaar, working on news as it relates to entertainment, fashion, and culture. Previously, she was a news editor at ABC News and, prior to that, a managing editor of celebrity news at American Media. She has also written features for Rolling Stone, Teen Vogue, Forbes, and The Hollywood Reporter, among other outlets. 
Quinci LeGardye is an LA-based freelance writer who covers culture, politics, and mental health through a Black feminist lens. When she isn’t writing or checking Twitter, she’s probably watching the latest K-drama or giving a concert performance in her car.

title: All the Celebrity Breakups in 2023 (So Far)
text:
Love comes and goes, but the going tends to be much more dramatic. It's only spring, but the year 2023 has seen the end of several high-profile celebrity relationships, and there will likely be more to come. It's not a wish; it's just a fact.
Check below to see if any of your favorites have said goodbye to one another this year.

Taylor Swift and Joe Alwyn's six-year romance was kept mostly private by the couple, although Alwyn inspired many of Swift's love songs over the years. News of their secret breakup, which took place in March and was initiated by Swift, broke on April 8. A source told People days later that although they had talked about marriage just months before, greater incompatibilities made it clear to the pair that they weren't right for the long, long term. “Joe has struggled with Taylor's level of fame and the attention from the public,” the source said. “The differences in their personalities have also become harder to ignore after years together. They've grown apart.”
“Taylor didn't see them working out in the long run,” the source added.
Soon after her break up with Alwyn, Taylor Swift was romantically connected to The 1975 frontman Matt Healy. The two had been linked for a brief time in 2014, but never confirmed anything. It seemed like they were very hot and heavy for a month or two, but sources said they split in June for good.
Elle Fanning, 24, and Max Minghella, 37, were first linked in July 2018 when they were seen holding hands in Florence, Italy, according to Us Weekly. The pair worked together on Teen Spirit, which Fanning starred in and Minghella wrote and directed that same year. The project is where their love story started. (Read more about their history here.)
Throughout their run as a couple, both members opted to keep intimate details to themselves, although they would sometimes go to events together or post Instagrams showing moments from their life together.
Fanning announced the pair's breakup indirectly during her interview with Harper's Bazaar UK, published at the beginning of April. She revealed she was currently single but hopeful about finding love again. “I’m a hopeless romantic. I believe in love at first sight,” she said. “Call me crazy, but I believe in those things. I feel that it’s my destiny.”
Captain Marvel star Brie Larson and Elijah Allan-Blitz, a 36-year-old virtual reality director, were first photographed kissing in July 2019. The couple didn't talk about their relationship much while dating, but they did attend events together, such as the 2020 Oscars, The Daily Front Row's 2022 fashion awards in Los Angeles, and the D23 Expo in September 2022. The pair worked together on The Messy Truth VR Experience series, which earned them an Emmy in the ceremony's outstanding original interactive program category, per People.
Larson and Allan-Blitz were last photographed together showing affection in September 2022, as seen above. 
Larson revealed that they privately broke up sometime after during a Harper's Bazaar interview published in late March 2023. She didn't specify when exactly the split occurred. She only said she's open to what's next in her life: “I don’t have a next job. I don’t have a home. I don’t have a partner. I don’t have a plan. I’m just completely open.”
Noel Gallagher and Sara MacDonald met in the year 2000 while in Ibiza, and they got married in 2011. After 12 years of wedded life, they announced on January 16, 2023, that they were getting a divorce. 
“Noel and Sara will together continue to look after their children who remain their priority,” a spokesperson said. “Noel and Sara ask the media to respect their privacy and that of our family at this time.”
The former couple share two sons, Donovan, 15, and Sonny, 12. Gallagher has a daughter, Anaïs, 22, who he had in his former marriage to Meg Mathews, who he divorced in 2001.
After five years together, Maisie Williams and Reuben Selby broke up. Williams shared the news with her followers on February 23, posting a selfie with Selby on her Instagram Stories. 
Over the pic, she wrote, “The end of an era. @reubenselby_ and I decided to end our relationship. Since we met 5 years ago, our connection always extended deeply into our shared, and separate, creative careers... and it will continue to do so."
She continued, “This decision is something we are so grateful or as we can protect the magic, that we can't help but emit, whenever we put our brains together. P.s no further questions, please, we must protect our children (my dog).”
Selby reshared the announcement in his own Stories, adding a heart emoji.
Avril Lavigne and Mod Sun started dating in January 2021, and became engaged in April 2022. But they ended their relationship, confirming their split on February 21.
“Avril and Mod Sun have been on and off for the past two months, but are no longer together as a couple,” an insider told People. 
Mod Sun posted in early March that his life had “completely changed” on Instagram.
“In 1 week my entire life completely changed,” he said in the caption. “I just know there’s a plan for it all. 💔 Being surrounded by love every night on tour has been an absolute blessing. I have the best friends in the entire world, thanks for always having my back. See you on stage.”
After eight months together, singer Camila Cabello and Lox Club CEO Austin Kevitch split up after first being linked in summer of 2022. Entertainment Tonight reports that the news broke when a newsletter for Lox Club subscribers stated that, “Austin is single again.” 
In news that shook the reality TV fandom, Tom Sandoval and Ariana Madix broke it off in March 2023 after nine years together. The breakup was famously instigated by Sandoval's ongoing affair with Vanderpump Rules costar Raquel Leviss. 
“They had been having problems for a while, but this was the final straw for Ariana,” and insider told People. “She put up with a lot over the years, but she won't sit back and be disrespected this way.”
Maddie Ziegler and Eddie Benjamin went public with their relationship in March 2020 after about a year together, but a source close to the couple told People that the Dance Moms alum and Australian singer broke up in February after three years.
Their last photos together posted on Zeigler's Instagram page were three months ago around the Christmas holidays.

Just days shy of their 12th wedding anniversary, Witherspoon announced on her Instagram that she and her husband Jim Toth had decided to separate. She wrote in a statement from the former couple:
In late July, 2023, it was reported that Rosalía and Rauw Alejandro had split and broken off their engagement after two years together. The former couple recently released a three-song EP titled RR featuring the hit song “Beso.”  
“Yes, a few months ago Rosi and I ended our engagement,” Alejandro wrote in his Instagram Stories July 26. “There are thousands of problems that could cause a breakup, but in our case it was not due to third parties or infidelity.”
He added, “During the space that I am taking to assimilate all of this, erroneous public allegations have emerged, and out of the respect I have for her, our families and all that we lived through, I could not stay silent and continue to watch how they try to destroy the story of the most real love that God has permitted me to live.” 
“I never saw myself in a position of even thinking that I would have to give public statements on this matter that is so private to me,” he concluded.
A day later, Rosalía wrote a statement on her Instagram Stories.
“I love, respect and admire Raúl very much,” she said. “Not paying attention to the theatrics, we know what we have experienced. This moment is not easy so thanks to everyone for understanding and respecting.”
Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his wife, Sophie, announced their separation after 18 years of marriage. The couple were married in 2005. They'd actually know one another in their childhoods, but reconnected again in 2003 at a charity gala. They share three children, 15-year-old Xavier, 14-year-old Ella-Grace and 9-year-old Hadrien. 
“As always, we remain a close family with deep love and respect for each other and for everything we have built and will continue to build,” they said in a statement on Instagram. 
Ariana Grande and Dalton Gomez reportedly broke up in January, but it was noted in July when the Wicked star was seen at Wimbledon without her wedding ring. Soon after, it was confirmed that she is dating her co-star Ethan Slater.
They first broke up in November 2021 after dating for two years.  In July of 2023, it was confirmed that model Bella Hadid had broken up a few minutes earlier. In April of 2022, she shared some more about her relationship with Vogue, saying, “I think that’s why things have been able to last. When you give other people room to have opinions on things that are so personal to you, it poisons it.”
Camila Cabello and Shawn Mendes broke up in November of 2021, but in April of 2023 they sparked dating rumors again when they were seen kissing at Coachella. However, a source told Entertainment Tonight in June, “Shawn and Camila broke up and are no longer seeing each other. They gave things a try, but ultimately the timing isn't right for either of them. They're both staying busy and doing their own things.” 
The couple announced their divorce on July 17, 2023, after seven years of marriage and one of dating. Manganiello filed, citing “irreconcilable differences” as the reason for their split.
“They have been growing apart for some time now and tried to resolve things, but they are focused on different areas of their lives,” a source told People. “They definitely love and respect each other, but once that initial passion dies down and other areas get in the way, then little differences get bigger.”
Shortly after their 11th wedding anniversary, Portman and Millepied reportedly separated after news of the choreographer's affair, with 25-year-old climate activist Camille Étienne, broke. They have supposedly been working on rebuilding trust because the actress wants to preserve a home for their two children.
“Natalie believes Benjamin’s affair was a brief and stupid liaison that means nothing to him,” a source told US Weekly in August 2023.
After 14 months of marriage and seven years together, Spears and Asghari separated at the end of July 2023. The marriage has “been on the rocks for months” according to a source. 
Though they have yet to comment on their alleged split, TMZ reported that Jonas and Turner's relationship has been “circling the drain” for the past six months over Labor Day weekend. He has supposedly contacted divorce lawyers in the Los Angeles area as the two face conflict over the care of their two daughters.
After 27 years together, actor Hugh Jackman and his wife Deborra-Lee Furness announced in a statement to People that they were breaking up on September 15, 2023.
“We have been blessed to share almost 3 decades together as husband and wife in a wonderful, loving marriage,” they wrote. “Our journey now is shifting and we have decided to separate to pursue our individual growth.”
The statement continued, “Our family has been and always will be our highest priority. We undertake this next chapter with gratitude, love, and kindness. We greatly appreciate your understanding in respecting our privacy as our family navigates this transition in all of our lives...This is the sole statement either of us will make.”
The pair share two children, Oscar and Ava. They met on the set of Australian TV series Corelli, and were married a year later.
On Monday, October 2, Jodie Turner-Smith filed for divorce from Joshua Jackson after being married for nearly four years. They share a three-year-old child. The former couple was recently photographed together, but a source told Entertainment Tonight that they have been having issues and Turner-Smith is firm in her decision to end the marriage.
“Jodie and Joshua have been having issues lately,” the source said. “They celebrated Jodie’s birthday on September 9 at The Flower Shop in NYC but arrived separately and left separately. It was a big party, and they were distant throughout the night and barely around each other. Jodie spent majority of the evening downstairs.”
Another source told US Weekly, “Joshua was clearly caught off guard by Jodie’s decision to divorce...They had their issues, as many couples do—especially two busy actors who are also juggling a child. Joshua obviously didn’t realize it was this bad, that Jodie was this unhappy.”
Aimée Lutkin is the weekend editor at ELLE.com. Her writing has appeared in Jezebel, Glamour, Marie Claire and more. Her first book, The Lonely Hunter, will be released by Dial Press in February 2022.
Alyssa Bailey is the senior news and strategy editor at ELLE.com, where she oversees coverage of celebrities and royals (particularly Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton). She previously held positions at InStyle and Cosmopolitan. When she's not working, she loves running around Central Park, making people take #ootd pics of her, and exploring New York City.
